item.title: Gateway Shuttle for Thanksgiving Break
item.description: RPI’s Department of Parking and Transportation will again offer Gateway shuttle service to the Albany International Airport, Albany Bus Terminal, and Amtrak Train Station for Thanksgiving break. Shuttles depart from the RPI Student Union horseshoe via CDTA bus. To reserve a seat, email hosgob@rpi.edu or call 518-276-6616 by Wednesday, November 19. Please be sure to include your full name, RIN and which departure date and time you would like to sign up for.

item.title: Econ Club Discussion: Affordable Health Coverage at a Crossroads? | Nov. 19
item.description: Join the Econ Club to learn about and discuss how health care subsidies caused a record-breaking US government shutdown in Sage 3205 at 5pm on 11/19.

item.title: ASCE Chapter meeting | Nov. 20
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 20, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join fellow students and Don Adams from Creighton Manning before heading home for the holiday. Mr. Adams will discuss his company’s Adirondack Rail Project. This project transformed a 34-mile railroad corridor into a multi-use trail designed for pedestrians, bicyclists, snowmobilers, and cross-country skiers. Refreshments will be served.

item.title: NYS Taxation & Finance Tabling | Nov. 18
item.description: The New York State Department of Taxation and Finance will be in the RPI Student Union on Tuesday, November 18th from 11:00am – 2:00pm. Stop by to learn more about the career opportunities available, including the Data Analyst position and other potential openings across the department. This is a great opportunity to meet with a representative, ask questions, and gain insight into the department’s career paths, organizational culture, and the important work they do serving New York State.

item.title: Title IX and Beyond: Understand Your Rights
item.description: Join us for Title IX and Beyond, an informational session focused on understanding your rights, navigating personal and professional boundaries, and learning about reporting pathways at RPI and in the workplace. The event will be held on Tuesday, November 18, at 4 p.m. in the Bruggeman Room, CBIS, with Jackie McPhillips Balcerak and Elizabeth Brown-Goyette. All students, faculty, and staff are welcome.

Without appropriate mitigation, Windows 10 systems are non-compliant with multiple RPI security policies. Please click in for additional information.

item.title: Presence, Play, and Collective Dreaming: Embodied Social Practice as Research with Jane Rigler
item.description: This interactive experience explores how engaged social practice can serve as a methodology for collective research and restorative community building. Through facilitated invitation, inspired by the work of Pauline Oliveros (musician, humanitarian, and founder of Deep Listening), participants explore presence and play, cultivating capacity for orientation to what is emerging in this moment. Join at EMPAC Studio Beta from 5-7pm on 11/19.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop- Book Discussion-“Powered by Me: From Burned Out to Fully Charged at Work and in Life” – Virtual Class | Nov. 20
item.description:
Date: Thursday, November 20, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Join an instructor-led discussion of Powered by Me: From Burned Out to Fully Charged at Work and in Life by Neha Sangwan (Available in Percipio). Burnout is an energy crisis across five key dimensions—physical, mental, emotional, social, and spiritual. Together, we’ll explore how chronic stress depletes our energy, erodes our relationships, and diminishes our sense of purpose.
